title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Tuesday 8 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: murder charge over hostel attack death .
'horrendous ' child sex abuser jailed for 22 years .
new midland mainline trains 'will go slower ' .
weather : rain expected throughout the day .

documents.title: funny moments from 25 years of the premier league
text: funny moments from 25 years of the premier league

documents.title: the subversive genius of joe orton
text: the subversive genius of joe orton
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: foxes team up for garden games
text: foxes team up for garden games

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: dedicated live coverage has now ended , but some news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear on this page through the night .
they 'll resume at 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: weather : wet and windy night ahead
text: staying cloudy this evening with further spells of rain that will be heavy at times overnight .
winds will strengthen through the night making it feel colder .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: your photos : rainy weather in notts
text: it 's been a pretty wet day .
this photo from steve a in kimberley sums things up ( we particularly liked the numberplate trickery ! )
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: a1 remains shut after pasta sauce lorry fire
text: the a1 north remains closed in rutland after a lorry carrying pasta sauce caught fire earlier .
highways england expects the road - shut between the junctions with the a47 and the a606 - to open by about 18:30 .
thankfully the driver was unhurt in the blaze .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: football : chelsea 'highly rate ' danny drinkwater
text: danny drinkwater joining chelsea `` fits '' with what antonio conte 's squad needs , according to former leicester captain matt elliott .
national newspaper reports have continued to link england international drinkwater with a move to the capital .
elliott told bbc radio leicester 's football forum : `` the more you think about it , the more it fits .
`` i think chelsea are looking at buying him as cover , even though they obviously rate him quite highly .
`` will they be willing to pay over the odds for drinkwater ? ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : dinosaurs of china exhibit value for money ?
text: it appears the price of going to the dinosaurs of china exhibition at wollaton hall ( see 14:46 ) has sparked plenty of debate over on the bbc radio nottingham facebook page .
steven pires allsop writes : `` bit of a let down for the money over in about half hour . ''
tony durrant seems more upbeat : `` not long back from there , wet soggy day so wife and i along with the grandson went this morning .
wife and i thought it was good , interesting and enjoyable but the grandson described it as `` brilliant . ''
whilst anthony allen adds : `` i would love to go but with 6 kids it works out expensive . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: dashcam footage sought after woman 's a38 death
text: police have made a fresh appeal for dashcam footage after a woman died in a crash on the a38 last week .
the woman , who has yet to be named , was found dead on the southbound carriageway near ripley on thursday night .
detectives investigating the death are keen to view any footage motorists may have .
call 101 if you can help .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hales coy about england test return
text: hales coy about england test return

documents.title: lorry carrying pasta sauce goes up in flames
text: a fire on board a lorry carrying thousands of jars of pasta sauce is likely to close a section the a1 for the next few hours .
leicestershire fire and rescue said the closure , near the junction for the a606 on the northbound carriageway , would allow for the hgv and glass to be cleared .
the service added that the driver had sustained no injuries in the blaze .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derbyshire and notts suffer washout
text: derbyshire and notts suffer washout

documents.title: staff 'threatened with fake gun ' during attempted robbery in matlock
text: a robber left empty-handed after threatening staff at a newsagent shop in matlock this morning .
police said the man entered the smedley street east store at about 07:30 holding what appeared to be an imitation handgun and demanded money from the till .
when staff refused he left the shop and headed off in the direction of henry avenue .
police now want to hear from anyone who saw a man wearing a black tracksuit and hooded jacket loitering near the shop 's entrance with his face partially covered .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: government praises rutland 's social care provision
text: rutland county council has been ranked the top local authority in the country for its social care services , according to the department for health .
social care provision helps reduce strain on the national health service .
each local authority has been assessed on its performance in six areas , before an overall ranking is reached .
in total , 152 local authorities were assessed .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: drowned boy was saving friend , says coroner
text: drowned boy was saving friend , says coroner

documents.title: deaf teenager found safe and well
text: police say 16-year-old thomas ashmore-barbosa , who was reported missing from his home in calow on sunday , has been found safe and well .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : day three of derbys v notts abandoned
text: inevitably , play has been abandoned for the day at the county ground .
let 's hope conditions improve for day four .
author: Dave Fletcher
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: watch : the lord of milan film trailer released
text: the team behind the project to remember the nottingham-born founder of ac milan , have released this movie trailer , ahead of the film 's release later this year .
note : third party content may contain adverts .
the lord of milan , telling the story of herbert kilpin , will have its world premiere in nottingham in october .
it will then be shown at the milan sports film festival in november .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: on this day : ashes anniversary
text: england needed just 39 minutes to take three australian wickets to win the ashes at trent bridge on this day two years ago .
the remarkable win , famous for hometown hero stuart broad 's 8-15 on day one , was capped by this spectacular flypast by the red arrows
as england 's players stayed for hours to take and sign autographs for the crowd .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dinosaurs of china exhibition receives mixed reviews
text: fifty thousand people have been to the dinosaurs exhibition at wollaton hall during its first month , according to nottingham city council .
visitors to the exhibition have come from as far afield as new zealand and malaysia , but it has also received mixed reviews from visitors .
`` i was a bit disappointed as there was n't much for the kids to interact with , '' one woman leaving the attraction told bbc radio nottingham .
but this man said he was impressed : `` we 've travelled up from rugby , it is very nice actually .
there are lots of things that are n't in the london or oxford [ natural history ] exhibitions . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fox family team up for garden games
text: fox family team up for garden games

documents.title: pair arrested after man found injured and unconscious
text: detectives have arrested two men in connection with a suspected assault on a man found injured on a leicester housing estate .
an ambulance crew found the 19-year-old unconscious when they were called to bendbow rise in braunstone in the early hours of sunday .
the man is in a stable condition .
author: Christian Hill
BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: murder accused remanded in custody
text: a 60-year-old man 's been remanded in custody after appearing before magistrates this morning charged with murder .
martin mcdermott is accused of killing 44-year-old leslie salmon , who died in hospital shortly after being attacked at a hostel in bass street , derby , on sunday .
mr mcdermott will appear at nottingham crown court tomorrow .
author: Aleena Naylor
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: sewer repairs may take two more months
text: nottingham city transport says emergency roadworks in the city centre could take another two months to complete .
a collapsed sewer at the junction of parliament street and clumber street led to gridlock during yesterday afternoon 's rush hour .
the company says it 'll continue to monitor things today .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: holme pierrepont caravan fire 'probably an arson attack '
text: a little update on yesterday 's caravan fire in holme lane , near holme pierrepont
nottinghamshire fire and rescue service has told us the blaze is believed to have been started deliberately .
a spokesman added it appeared the fire spread quite quickly due to high winds .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man 'stunned ' as 99p glass valued at £ 150
text: a man paid 99p for a fancy glass at a derbyshire charity shop - only to learn it could be worth up to £ 150 .
the buyer had the elegant glass valued at hansons auctioneers and it was identified as a `` highly collectable '' item created by famous austrian designer koloman moser in 1900 .
it 's due to go under the hammer in etwall in october with a guide price of £ 100 to £ 150 .
hansons ' decorative arts specialist john keightley said : `` our vendor bought the glass in a derbyshire charity shop simply because he liked it .
`` he was stunned when i told him it was by koloman moser , whose work is sought after . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rain sees no play at leicestershire
text: rain sees no play at leicestershire

documents.title: 'no injuries ' after station street coach crash
text: we 've now heard back from national express after one of its coaches crashed into a bus shelter on station street in nottingham earlier .
a company spokesman said : `` we can confirm one of our vehicles was involved in a collision with a bus shelter in nottingham this morning .
`` there were no passengers on board and no third parties were involved in the incident .
we have recovered the vehicle and work is being undertaken to repair the shelter . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bus shelter crash 'being dealt with '
text: we asked nottingham city council what they could tell us about a coach crashing into a bus shelter in station street this morning .
they responded : `` we have an arrangement with our contractor jc deceaux to deal with incidents of damage to bus shelters as quickly as possible and they are on site doing that . ''
we will update you with more information when we have it .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : play looking unlikely at derbys v notts
text: the umpires are having another look at the county ground pitch as the rain continues to fall .
author: Dave Fletcher
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: rugby : tuilagi incident 'particularly disappointing '
text: leicester tigers head coach matt o'connor said he will be speaking to manu tuilagi after the centre was sent home early from an england training camp .
tuilagi , 26 , who has not played for england since 2016 , was sent home along with denny solomona for what is being described as `` team culture issues . ''

o'connor , who returned to leicester last season , added the news was `` particularly disappointing because manu has worked so hard to get back to fitness after long-term injury and to get back into the england squad . ''
author: Chris Jones
BBC 5 live rugby union reporter

documents.title: your photos : soggy golf green
text: the weather 's pretty grotty today - certainly not great conditions for golf , as bry in ilkeston has been finding
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'horrendous ' child sex abuser jailed for 22 years
text: a 72-year-old man who repeatedly abused a child over a 15 year period has been jailed .

police said john worsley , of victory avenue , ripley was given a 22 year sentence at derby crown court after being found guilty of 12 charges including multiple rapes , indecent assaults and cruelty .
the offences took place in ripley between 1974 and 1989 , starting when the child was six and continuing until she became pregnant by him at the age of 21 .
as well as being sexually abused , the victim was also physically and mentally abused , including being punished with a riding crop .

det con mick wallis , who investigated the offences , said : the victim of these crimes found the strength to report the abuse to us after many years of living with the turmoil and i have so much respect for her , particularly after she gave her evidence during a lengthy court trial .
`` she did the right thing by reporting these matters to police and i am pleased that worsley has been brought to justice for the horrendous crimes that he committed . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: caravan destroyed by fire in notts
text: this is all that remains of a caravan that was on fire on a lane in notts yesterday afternoon .
the fire service said the blaze , in holme lane , near holme pierrepont , was called in to them at 15:15 and had been put out by 15:53 .
there were no injuries and the cause has not yet been established .
it 's thought the caravan had been parked in the lane for about two weeks .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paper talk : leicester midfielder heading to the capital ?
text: leicester midfielder danny drinkwater has emerged as a top target for chelsea , according to the london evening standard .
author: Evening Standard

documents.title: cancer drug 'took away my skin colour '
text: a woman has admitted she feels like she is losing her identity after a cancer drug removed most of the pigment in her skin .
paula edwards , from shepshed , leicestershire , has terminal kidney cancer .
`` it is my identity , '' she told bbc radio leicester .
`` i 'm a black woman , i 'm british born my blackness is my identity .
`` my girls are black , my youngest is nine and she said 'you do n't look like my mummy any more ' and that ripped my heart out . ''
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: deaf teenager goes missing from derbyshire home
text: police say they 're concerned about the safety of a deaf teenager who 's gone missing from his home in derbyshire .
thomas ashmore-barbosa was last seen in top road , calow , on sunday afternoon .
it 's thought he may be in sheffield or west yorkshire .

derbyshire police said : `` thomas is deaf and anyone who sees him in public is advised to tap him on the shoulder and try to communicate with him as clearly as possible , either verbally or using a writing aid . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'coach smash ' shatters nottingham bus shelter
text: this is the scene on station street in nottingham , where it appears a coach has got too close for comfort with a bus shelter .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pair questioned over drug offences after normanton house fire
text: two men have been arrested on sus of growing cannabis following an investigation into the cause of a house fire in normanton yesterday .
emergency crews were called to the house on vincent street in the early hours of monday after reports of a fire in the roof .
the men , aged 54 and 59 , have been released while investigations continue .
author: Aleena Naylor
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: woman left 'foxed ' by garden visitors
text: a woman got an unexpected surprise when she looked out her window to find a skulk of foxes had taken up residence in her garden .
annie brookes , from leicester , tweeted : `` 8 on the lawn tonight but sadly they would n't stay in the frame all at the same time . ''
there are actually seven foxes in the below .
can you spot them all ?
an omen ahead of the new football season perhaps ?
8 on the lawn tonight but sadly they would n't stay in the frame all at the same time .
eight
bringing friends and relatives along
lol !
no , same lot as always .
i do n't know how you ever get anything done .
i 'd spend all my time watching them
i do n't !
lol !
did the dinner , washed up , took the dog & that 's it !
lol !
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : notts batsman hales 'should return to test team '
text: former england spinner graeme swann believes that alex hales should be recalled to the test team for the series against the west indies .
swann , a former county colleague of hales at nottinghamshire , made the suggestion after incumbent opener keaton jennings averaged just 15 against south africa .
`` the reason alex hales did n't do it in test cricket was that he believed all the press that he had to change his technique , '' swann told test match special .
`` i think that 's nonsense .
in one-day cricket , he has a simple game .
if it 's straight , he blocks it , anything else , he smacks it .
i 'd bring him back to open . ''
hales , 28 , who struck 218 against derbyshire on monday , has an average of 27 from 11 tests .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thomas joins leicester from coventry
text: thomas joins leicester from coventry

documents.title: access to university education 'would have changed brexit vote '
text: britain would have voted to stay in the european union if more people had gone to university , a new study has suggested .
researchers at the university of leicester argue that access to higher education was the `` predominant factor '' dividing those who voted remain and those who voted to leave .
dr aihua zhang , from the university 's department of mathematics , analysed data to look at factors that influenced voting preferences as well as the odds ratio in favour of leave .
`` the eu referendum raised significant debate and speculation of the intention of the electorate and its motivations in voting , '' dr zhang said .
`` much of this debate was informed by simple data analysis examining individual factors , in isolation , and using opinion polling data .
`` this , in the case of the eu referendum where multiple factors influence the decision simultaneously , failed to predict the eventual outcome . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : no play before lunch at county ground
text: unsurprisingly , day three of derbyshire v nottinghamshire will not be getting under way at 11:00 .
derbyshire say there will be no play at the county ground before lunch and the umpires will be reinspecting the pitch at 13:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : foxes sign george thomas from coventry
text: new signing alert
# lcfc have completed the signing of coventry city youngster george thomas on a three-year contract
500k for a forward that has n't even proved himself in the coventry team , 6 goals in 40 games , you can have him
and you can have conference football
haha , they 're literally l2 .
a lot of our fans wo n't remember what absolute mongs the cov lot are .
good transfer if just to pee them off
such a witty and intellectual response
can you park there with your blue badge pal ?
i wish him the best of luck
not quite sigurddson , or malang sarr , or ben gibson , or johnny evans or ziyech though is it
nor was vardy or mahrez
you think this guys gon na be like one of them ?
who knows , just do n't see why you 're comparing him to more expensive players .
'expensive ' player must mean they are a 'good ' player ?
do n't associate the the 2 , it 's a fools game .
# buildateam
dat is good
as someone who attends cov games as i live there i can say this guy is class like calum wilson that bournemouth signed from cov too
what ?
wilson scored 23 from 42 games .
thomas scored 9 from 33 .
thomas was ok at the end of last season but prior was barely making the bench
@ twitterid will george be put on fantasy league ?
a very good prospect
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester 'no longer uk 's greatest sporting city '
text: leicester has lost its title of the uk 's greatest sporting city to liverpool , according to research by espn and the university of bath .
the study , which looks at the best place to be a sports fan , saw leicester drop from first to 12th .
sports fans were asked for their views on factors including value for money , transport and match day experiences .
elsewhere , nottingham were ranked 14th and derby 17th .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: climber seriously injured in stanage edge fall
text: a climber suffered serious injuries in a fall in the peak district at the weekend .
edale mountain rescue team said the woman fell about three metres and landed awkwardly at stanage edge on sunday afternoon .
she was treated at the scene before being flown to a trauma unit in sheffield by air ambulance .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rowett : grimsby game 'a chance for others to impress '
text: derby county will have four players missing for tonight 's league cup match at grimsby .
tom huddlestone , bradley johnson , johnny russell and craig bryson all look set to miss out through injury .
rams boss gary rowett said it would provide an opportunity for others in the squad .
`` there 's five or six players who perhaps feel a little hard done by that they 've not featured in starting line-ups - it 's the first chance for them to show what they can do , '' he said .
`` these types of games are difficult because if you do n't work as hard as the opposition or if your attitude 's not as good , you 'll lose . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: transport bosses defend 'slower ' bi-mode trains
text: radio derby 's political reporter has the official response to this morning 's revelation that bi-mode trains set to serve the midland mainline in the future will actually be slower than those currently used .
the department for transport 's responded to our story about bi-mode trains being slightly slower than electric ones .
transport journalist @ twitterid says the east midlands should be annoyed about being given bi-mode trains instead of electric ones .
the dft are insulting public intelligence .
the emids mainline has been downgraded because of a fictional # hs2 business case .
simple truth .
utter rubbish for which you offer no evidence other than your opinion .
how very # stophs2 ( & why # stophs2isdead ) .
# hs2
from the mouth of a 3rd rate commercial photographer with limited intellectual capabilities .
biggy # hs2 astroturfer and all round # stooge !
how will your childish outbursts persuade anyone to stop # hs2 ?
your campaign 's gone the way of the dodo .
it 's all over bar the ranting .
the scarr bottom road idiot has spoken .
hs2 astroturfer and all round fool biggy !
a fool is someone who does n't know when to give up .
most # hs2 antis did years ago .
so what does that make you ?
# stophs2isdead
# bullybigland , you 've obviously not been following the # mml lack of electrification story to come out with such rubbish .
`` allow passengers to benefit from faster journeys '' lol .
so they are not saying your story is wrong !
it 's a wonderful 'non-answer ' .
bi-modes are indeed very capable but they are not as good as , or as environmentally friendly as electrics .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'gun fired ' after worksop car crash
text: a 25-year-old man has been arrested following reports a gun was fired after a car crash in worksop .
police said they were called to a two-car crash in retford road at 00:45 on saturday but were told about the gun later .
it 's not thought anyone was injured in the incident but police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : tuilagi 'broke team code of conduct '
text: manu tuilagi 's removal from england 's three-day training camp `` shows that no one is above the law , '' according to his national team mate danny care .
the bbc understands that leicester centre tuilagi , 26 , and denny solomona went out drinking after a team meal and did not return to the hotel until around 04:00 .
the incident comes just days after england head coach eddie jones said he would be prepared to tuilagi for the the autumn internationals .
`` they 've breached the code of conduct that the players try and live by , '' scrum-half care said .
`` it shows that no one is above the law .
that 's the way it has been since eddie has taken over .

`` he knows the strength in depth there is in the country at the moment and the number of players he can from , so you do n't want to make many mistakes because you never know what 's going to happen . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : wet weather across east midlands
text: it 's august - but it feels more like november out there .
this is how it looks in kegworth :
thanks to bbc weather watcher scrappy for the
it is looking similarly bleak at risley , derbyshire .
thanks to sothers for the
it 's the same story in warsop near mansfield - thanks to annbie for the
i just hope it is n't someone 's lunch
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man facing murder charge over hostel attack death
text: a 60-year-old man has been charged with murder after another man died when he was attacked at a hostel in derby .
leslie salmon , 44 , died in hospital after being found injured at the centre in bass street early on sunday .
martin mcdermott , who was living at the hostel , is due before magistrates later .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new midland mainline trains will be slower , government says
text: radio derby 's learned that the government 's decision to scrap the electrification of trains between derby and london will mean slower journeys .
three weeks ago , the government said its new bi-mode trains - that run on electric and diesel - would mean `` quicker journey times '' , but now it 's admitted that 's not quite the whole story .
journey times will reduce - because lines are being straightened and junctions improved .
the trains will actually be slower than the electric ones the government has scrapped .

the group which represents rail operators says the bi-mode trains are heavier , less powerful and more expensive to buy , more expensive to maintain and more expensive to operate than their electric cousins .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: watch : stoney street car park to reopen after basement fire
text: a car park in nottingham city centre is expected to fully reopen today after being closed because of a fire yesterday .
the ncp car park in stoney street was shut at lunchtime after a car caught fire in its basement .
the blaze spread to 10 other vehicles and a further 20 were damaged by smoke and heat .
investigations are under way to establish the cause of the fire .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : latest from region 's roads
text: here 's a look at how things are on the region 's roads :
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: after a damp start we 're going to have more rain on the way later
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live updates
text: good morning and welcome along to tuesday across the east midlands .
gavin bevis and i will be with you until later with the best of the region 's news , sport , weather and travel .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live
